messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re:Thanks Melissa!
messages.msgSnippet: Louisiana is 7.So does that mean hold off until she is 7 until i fill out AN paperwork? Georgette Debra Rossing  wrote: You re
messages.messageBody:
Louisiana is 7.So does that mean hold off until she is 7 until i fill out AN paperwork?
Georgette

Debra Rossing <debra.rossing@...> wrote:
You're already in it - just check the laws of your state as to when you
might need to do any legal paperwork or folderol such as that since
you've got an up and coming 5 yr old. You may or may not need to do
anything yet (not every state has 5 as the compulsory attendance age)

Deb

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Thanks Melissa!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Now why would you even think to do that?  I think you missed my point.  One thing that might be helpful is to recognize that unschooling means letting go
messages.messageBody:
>From: Georgette Teekel <beautifulsassyprincess@...>

>That was very insightful!Thanks!One last thing:If i should just let
>things"happen"then at "school age" should i buy into like Abeka,Sonlight or
>None?
>
Now why would you even think to do that? I think you missed my point. One
thing that might be helpful is to recognize that unschooling means letting
go of the "school age" vernacular. All ages are learning ages...school
doesn't define what we do and how we do it.

don't waste your money on prescribed book work for kids under the age of (?)
..spend it on adventures, toys, traveling, museums, field trips, computers,
books, charitable endeavors, feeding the hungry and housing the homeless
etc. etc. etc.

Lisa Heyman

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] The "c" word
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: beautifulsassyprincess@yahoo.com That was very insightful!Thanks!One last thing:If i should just let things happen then at school age should i buy
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: beautifulsassyprincess@...

That was very insightful!Thanks!One last thing:If i should just let
things"happen"then at "school age" should i buy into like
Abeka,Sonlight or
None?


-=-=-=-

Have you read anything about unschooling?

What do you know about it? Where did you hear about it?

We don't use the "c" word here. <bwg>

Have you heard the terms "natural learning" or "organic learning?"
"Life learning?"

Why would anyone buy Sonlight or Abeka? What would you be looking for
from them?

How can you keep things from happening?



~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://www.LiveandLearnConference.org

messages.subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Thanks Melissa!
messages.msgSnippet: That was very insightful!Thanks!One last thing:If i should just let things happen then at school age should i buy into like Abeka,Sonlight or None? ... the
messages.messageBody:
That was very insightful!Thanks!One last thing:If i should just let things"happen"then at "school age" should i buy into like Abeka,Sonlight or None?

Lisa Heyman <Lmanathome@...> wrote:
>I appreciate your ideas,on teachimg my 2,3 and 4 yr old.My 4 yr
>old,will be 5 in July.
>With that being said,when would you start the "homeschool"process or am
>i already in it?
>

the truth about unschooling is that it is not a stop and start process.
There is no age limitation, no age requirement, no age restriction. You are
not in or out of it...life is it - you are it! this is not to say that
things won't change or evolve...in fact they very much will. your childs
interests may or may not change, but what will change, as they get older, is
the way in which they persue their interests. It is your job to stay
attentive so you can respond as your child changes and grows and reaches out
for new ways of exploring.

as a family who has always unschooled there was no difference in how we
lived our life when my child turned 'school' age. the differences on how
she approaches learning comes from her drives, desires and abilities. it is
amazing to witness the growth that organically occurs that has nothing to do
with anyone elses time frame or expectations. no one can predict how it
will unfold for each child.

Lisa heyman
